question: "Which car company, in 1986, comissioned ""Cars"", a series of artworks to track the evolution of its designs, from Andy Warhol?"
api_result: In 1986, the car company that commissioned Andy Warhol to create a series of artworks to track the evolution of its designs was Mercedes-Benz. The series was titled "Cars" and was intended to celebrate the centenary of the automobile. Warhol managed to complete 36 silkscreens and 13 drawings before his death in 1987.
